description.narrative: (i) Meeting Domestic Demand for Gas: Further exploration, appraisal and development of domestic gas resources will provide cleaner and affordable energy for further development of the industrial and power sectors in Egypt and Bulgaria, help to meet domestic gas demand and slow the pace of natural decline in production in Egypt, and reduce dependency on gas imports and its burden on the balance of payments in Bulgaria. (ii) Contribution to Government Revenues: The IFC financing will be used largely to fund developments aimed at prolonged production of gas from mature fields in Egypt and Bulgaria, positively impacting the revenues that the respective governments will receive. (iii) Employment: The project will create / preserve local employment with mainly high skilled jobs which will contribute to local skill development by providing opportunities to young workers / students. (iv) Private Sector Development: The project will support one of the very few private junior oil and gas companies operating in Algeria and provide a positive signal to other junior companies seeking to invest in the country.

Petroceltic International plc is a publicly listed upstream oil and gas company incorporated in Dublin, Ireland. Petroceltic recently merged with Melrose Resources plc, a previous client of IFC, and focuses on oil and gas exploration and development in the EMENA region. Petroceltic holds a balanced portfolio of exploration, development and production assets, primarily located in Egypt, Bulgaria, and Algeria. The proposed investment by IFC will help fund Petroceltics development and exploration program in Egypt, Bulgaria and Algeria.

name.narrative: In the Arab Republic of Egypt, Petroceltic holds 100% operated interests in three concession areas in the onshore Nile Delta (El Mansoura, South East El Mansoura and Qantara) and a 40% interest in the Mesaha exploration license in the south of the country. In Bulgaria, Petroceltic has a 100% operated interest in the Galata concession which includes three production licences for the Galata, Kavarna and Kaliakra gas fields and an exploration licence, all located in shallow waters in the Black Sea offshore Bulgaria. In Algeria, Petroceltic operates the Isarene field, located in the Illizi Basin in southeastern Algeria, with a 56.6% interest. Sonatrach, the Algerian national oil and gas company, holds a 25% interest and Enel Trade S.p.A. holds the remaining 18.4% which it acquired from Petroceltic in 2012.
